alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southeast; Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 2:59PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern La Paz, northwestern Yuma and east central Imperial Counties through 345 PM MST/345 PM PDT/... At 259 PM MST/259 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yuma Proving Ground, or 10 miles northeast of Martinez Lake, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martinez Lake and Yuma Proving Ground. This includes AZ Route 95 between mile markers 41 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southeast; Palo Verde Valley
